prompt: <description>- **Part 1: A cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation offsets. Your origin should be at (0, 0, 0). For this part, focus on creating the 2D sketch for the top of the cylinder. Create a new face and select the XY plane of the coordinate system as your sketch plane. Draw a circle at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375 units. Complete the sketch with a single loop and face. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles of [0, 0, 0] degrees and translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. This will maintain its position and orientation parallel to the XY plane. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.1734 units towards its normal vector, creating a flat, rounded top surface. The result should be a Construction CAD part representing the top section of the cylindrical object. - **Part 2: A second cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation offsets and translation offsets of [0.0938, 0.0938, 0.1734] to position this part on top of Part 1. Focus on creating the 2D sketch for the top of the second cylinder. Create a new face and select the XY plane of the current coordinate system as your sketch plane. Draw a circle at (0.2812, 0.2812) with a radius of 0.2812 units. Complete the sketch with a single loop and face. Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5625. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles of [0, 0, 0] and translation vector of [0, 0, 0] to maintain its position and orientation parallel to the XY plane. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.2812 units towards the normal vector. This will create the second tier of the cylindrical object. The result should be a Construction CAD part representing the middle section of the cylindrical object.</description>

Loop\\_1: A rectangle formed by four lines: * Line\\_1: Starting from [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.57, 0.0] * Line\\_2: Starting from [0.57, 0.0] and ending at [0.57, 0.75] * Line\\_3: Starting from [0.57, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line\\_4: Starting from [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] 2. The final dimensions of this part are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.009 Please ensure that all the curves, loops, and faces are generated accurately to create an error-free CAD model.</description>
